content.description:
Sit start with a left hand edge, and a right hand jug on a dubious flake. From there, bump the right up to a shelf, gain a left hand gaston, cross over (crux) with a high, right hand to a sidepull, mantle, then finish up the slab on jugs, and top it out.

Be mindful of the initial start flake, it held fine for me, but it wouldn't surprise me if breaks off.
content.protection: A few pads, the immediate landing is good, but there is a large rock behind the problem.
content.location: It ascends the northwest slab of Celladoora.

content.description:
Chew Smoke climbs high quality sandstone on an assortment of holds.

Sit start with a left hand three finger edge, a small right hand edge, a left heel hook, and the right foot flagged.  From there, stick a sloper to the right, set and fire further out right to a big sidepull (crux), reel in the feet, heel hook a small edge, then work up the face on thin edges, and top it out on the bumps.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is good, but there is a downed tree directly behind the problem.
content.location: This is on the north face of Celladoora Block.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on the shelf. Climb straight up the slight overhang using the good left hand holds on the arete while using the smaller set of features with the right hand on the face.

Rounding the arete onto the west face is off. Stay true to the overhang for the entirety.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The problem climbs between two trees. The one tree is a sapling and doesn't present much risk, but the juniper to the left could really hurt with a bad fall.
content.location: It climbs the southeast face of Celladoora.

content.description:
Basic Channeldom climbs an overhang on an assortment of holds over a perfect landing.

Sit start with a high, left hand sidepull in the vagina and a right hand horizontal crimp. From there, dyno up and right to a jug, find a foot edge, then work back left along the featured seam a few feet, gain a good left foot, find a combination of edges with the left hand in the runnel, reach a good right hand edge and finish up the remaining face for an easy top out.
content.protection: A pad or two should do, the landing is very good.
content.location: The problem climbs the southeast face of Celladoora.
